June 27, 1968
Memorandum #7
To: Communications Coordinators, President's Council on
Youth Opportunity
1. Advertising in Action — Community Mobilization
High on my desk is a pile of letters and memos from you, telling
of some of the work you have been doing. This is fascinating reading,
and reflects the devotion, time and talent you have given this program.
I'd like to reproduce it all for you, but it would be a volume.
But I thought you'd be interested in some of the highlights $ these
are just some of the activities in some of the cities. During these past
months, you all have supported the first priority — jobs for youth —
and the employment opportunities developed are due in important measure
to your cooperation with the NAB program.
We are recording everything we hear about, and look forward to having
a complete, city-by-city report for the Vice President and the AAAA.
I was most impressed by the material and information so many of you
sent in response to my last memorandum-the one telling of the
forthcoming Advertising Council press conference.
